text: Now that we're familiar with some of the basic concepts of image generation, let's talk about it in more depth.

Text to Image Generation

This is done by an AI that has already been trained. They’ve seen a lot of images with the words that describe them. Then, they use that knowledge to create their version of the described image.

This can be done by the tools that will be introduced later in this module.

Image to Image generation

To generate an image from an image, the AI is trained with two images: the original image, and the new image with some modification.

A way to think of this would be telling your computer to photoshop a picture for you.

Deepfakes are an example of this.

Deepfakes are digital media content created or manipulated using generative AI, most commonly used for images and videos.

Noise to Image

What is noise? People usually refer to noise as random sound they hear. When we refer it to images, it is similar.

Noise in images is just random pixels in a canvas. AI can use what it has learned to create an imaginary image of something that it has seen before. It takes the noise and transforms it to a picture.

This is similar to how people can think of a random picture of something in our heads.

Tools for Generation

Some common tools for image generation include:

  • Midjourney: this tool can be accessed by joining its discord or adding it as a bot onto servers. Midjourney can take text prompts and generate images.
  • Runway ML: this website has multiple AI tools, these tools can generate images, and make changes to images listed in the previous section.
  • DALL-E3: this tool comes with ChatGPT-4v

Deepfake Image Detection

Is it possible to distinguish between a real and fake image?

Yes. When deepfakes are generated, some artifacts are generated.

Artifacts are irregularities or uncommon features in manipulated or synthesised media content that expose their unauthentic nature.
